text: René Benjamin (1885 in Paris, France - 1948 in Tours, France) was a French author. In 1915 he received the Prix Goncourt for his novel Gaspard. In 1938, he became the first Goncourt laureate to be appointed a member of the Académie Goncourt, the jury that decides the winner of the prize. ==External links== * Category:1885 births Category:1948 deaths Category:Writers from Paris Category:People affiliated with Action Française Category:20th-century French novelists Category:20th-century French male writers Category:French military personnel of World War I Category:Prix Goncourt winners Category:Order of the Francisque recipients Category:French male novelists
title: René Benjamin
